findings.title: Funds can be claimed by anyone
findings.description: Anyone can claim funds left on the sale contract by calling the `PurchaseFor` function with a destination address as `vendor`.

findings.title: Funds left over from previous transactions are not retrievable
findings.description: The contract makes no control of the initial and end balance inside a single transaction, making it possible to have leftovers from previous transactions, which wouldn't be possible to retrieve.

findings.title: Contracts accept any incoming ether with no logic
findings.description: Both contracts implement a payable fallback with no logic, meaning they will accept any incoming ether with no data or with data that packs an erroneous call.

findings.title: Funds may be lost due to wrong address in requests[] array
findings.description: If there're any wrong address in the `requests[]`  array, it might cause funds to be lost.

findings.title: Payable fallback functions still present
findings.description: The contracts implement a payable fallback with no logic, meaning they will accept any incoming ether with no data or with data that packs an erroneous call.
